comments:
defining two use cases in a uml model and putting an include relationship between them, the validation process generate an exception:
Root exception:
java.lang.ClassCastException:org.eclipse.uml2.uml.internal.impl.IncludeImpl
at org.eclipse.uml2.uml.internal.operations.UseCaseOperations.allIncludedUseCases(UseCaseOperations.java:219)

The xmi model tested:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<uml:Model xmi:version="2.1" xmlns:xmi="http://schema.omg.org/spec/XMI/2.1" xmlns:uml="http://www.eclipse.org/uml2/2.0.0/UML" xmi:id="_r0QYcOlyEdqkC8CTvyl1qQ">
  <packagedElement xmi:type="uml:UseCase" xmi:id="_wCRRAOlyEdqkC8CTvyl1qQ" name="FirstUC"/>
  <packagedElement xmi:type="uml:UseCase" xmi:id="_zs9aEOlyEdqkC8CTvyl1qQ" name="SecondUC">
    <include xmi:type="uml:Include" xmi:id="_GFvzoOmREdqxSPkLxytqYQ" addition="_wCRRAOlyEdqkC8CTvyl1qQ"/>
  </packagedElement>
</uml:Model>

It is the complete error stack trace:
